sel.about



struct Software;
Informations about the software, like name, codename, versions and protocols used.

enum string name;
Formatted name of the software. It should be used for display and usage purposes.

Example:
writeln("You're running ", Software.name, " based on SEL");


enum string lname;
Lowercase name of the software.

Example:
assert(Software.name.toLower == Software.lname);


enum string website;
Website of the software. Source code should be at website/source and downloads at website/downloads.

Example:
download("http://" ~ Software.website ~ "/downloads/1.0.0.sa", "1.0.0.sa");


enum string codename;
enum string codenameEmoji;
enum string fullCodename;
Codename and representations related to the version or the group of versions of the software. Used only for display purposes.

enum ubyte major;
enum ubyte minor;
enum ubyte patch;
enum ubyte[3] versions;
Version of the software.

enum bool stable;
Indicates whether the current state of the software is stable. Unstable versions are not fully tested and may fail to compile on some systems.

enum string displayVersion;
Version of the software in format major.minor.patch following the (for example 
1.1.0
) for display purposes.

enum string fullVersion;
Full version of the software prefixed with a 
v
and suffixed with a 
-dev
if stable is false.

enum string display;
Display name of the software that contains both the software name and the version in the format name/version (for example 
SEL/1.1.0
).

enum ubyte api;
Version of the api used by the software. It's used to check the compatibility with plugins.

enum ubyte hncom;
Version of the hub-node communication protocol used by the software.

enum ubyte externalConsole;
Version of the external console protocol used by the software.

enum string[][uint] supportedMinecraftProtocols;
enum string[][uint] supportedPocketProtocols;
Protocols supported by the software.

alias SupportedMinecraftProtocols = E;
alias SupportedPocketProtocols = E;
Tuples with the supported protocols.

enum uint[] latestMinecraftProtocols;
enum uint[] latestPocketProtocols;
Array with the protocols for the latest game version. For example 315 and 316 if the latest Minecraft version is 1.11.

enum uint newestMinecraftProtocol;
enum uint newestPocketProtocol;
Latest protocol released.

enum bool __supported;
Indicates whether the software has been tested on the current OS

Page generated by Ddoc.
